title: Deaf Wrestler Virender Singh Joins Protest: Returns Padma Shri in Support of  Indian Wrestlers
content:
Deaf wrestler Virender Singh, known as "Goonga Pahalwan," has announced he will return his Padma Shri award in solidarity with protesting wrestlers Bajrang Punia, Vinesh Phogat, and Sakshi Malik. This decision comes after Punia returned his Padma Shri in protest against the election of Sanjay Singh, a close associate of accused former Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh.

Singh, a three-time Deaflympics gold medalist, expressed his support for the wrestlers, highlighting their fight against alleged sexual harassment and intimidation within the federation. His decision to return the prestigious award underscores the growing outrage and calls for accountability within Indian wrestling. 

This latest development adds to the escalating crisis within the sport, with athletes taking a stand against the perceived lack of action against those accused of wrongdoing.
